answers.answer: An evoked potential test measures time it takes for an electrical impulse to reach the brain from the text location. Abnormal means the time was longer than expected.Its not only done for MS as could be a result of your diabetes or any number of other factors. I would just wait for your Dr. to explain it to you.
You really need your doctor to take it in context. I do not know what he was looking for. I know it is hard to be patient.Alex

question: Evoked potentials abnormal results - what does this mean. Is this only MS.Yet to meet my doctor.But the technician which took the results said that results when electrodes in wrist were OK,  but not ones when placed in feet.right side only - legs arms, neck, head  - general weakness since 4 years.diabetic since 10 years
title: Evoked potentials abnormal results -  Is this only MS.
